channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Leaf fallen onto road and pavement, 25th November
item.description:
Loads of leafs on the floor and when it rains it becomes slippery yesterday I nearly fell could’ve ended bad as I would hit my head on the floor there kids coming out of school who can hurt themselves and elderly people been there for weeks now
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shacklewell Row, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of wet leaf mush, 25th November
item.description:
Sansom street has had no leaf clearing this autumn. Leaves are being crushed up and turning to mush and will block drains if not cleared
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sansom Street, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Broken concrete Bollard, 25th November
item.description:
This broken concrete bollard is waste from the pedestrian crossing built on St James Road Blue Anchor lane in April 2022. It’s been here more than 3 years and no one is removing it.

item.title: Overflowing trash and dumping of bulk items, 25th November
item.description:
Becoming a weekly issue, excess rubbish is dumped in the alleyway with more refuse than the bins can accommodate. This sees refuse just piled up with bags ripped open by foxes and litter flying down the street. There are not enough bins for the number of properties and suggest some larger bins are provided. The dumping of rubbish is unsightly and with the length of time it sits there waiting for weekly collection is hazardous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 122, Anerley Road, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Refer to map, 25th November
item.description:
For well over a month now a major bus route on the Kilburn Road has been disrupted causing further traffic congestion in the area by an unrepaired pothole. What is the challenge with mobilising a team to address this immediately?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kilburn High Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 broken slabs one in half and one rocking, 25th November
item.description:
The broken in half slab outside number 20 Harborough Avenue completely moves and has to be pushed back in very dangerous to all that walk by. Couple of steps along outside the path to 20 Harborough Avenue another slab that completely rocks when walked on.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Harborough Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
